cleaned_text: Essential Oils for Cleaning: The Ultimate Guide! The best essential oils for cleaning and disinfecting! Everything you need to know about cleaning with essential oils and making homemade cleaning recipes. I don't know about you, but it seems like every day I hear about more harmful products on the market. We have to be our own advocate, and ultimately it's up to us which chemicals we allow into our homes. Cleaning products are a common culprit of those chemicals. But did you know you can make your own natural cleaning products...using essential oils? Instead of buying store-bought products with difficult to pronounce mystery ingredients, use some simple ingredients and DIY it! Not only are essential oil cleaning recipes safe to use, they cost a lot less. And smell way better! Plus, they're totally customizable based on your favorite scents. Okay, let's dive into how to clean with essential oils! There are several essential oils that work best for cleaning. Here's a list of my favorites! Best essential oils for cleaning: 1. Lemon Naturally antibacterial and antiviral, [lemon oil](https://amzn.to/2E4ot1x) is also an excellent degreaser and makes your house smell fresh. It works well for bathrooms and kitchens, and for making wood floors and furniture shine. 2. Wild Orange Because of its citrus elements, [wild orange oil](https://amzn.to/34959uL) works well for dissolving grease or sticky residue. It has an energizing smell, and is best used on kitchen countertops and stovetops. 3. Eucalyptus Considered a natural germicide, [eucalyptus essential oil](https://amzn.to/2YCeWsf) works great for deterring pests, especially dust mites. It's also powerful for stopping mold and mildew. 4. Tea Tree Also called melaleuca, [tea tree oil](https://amzn.to/36hj8jw) is one of the strongest essential oils for cleaning. It kills off nasty bacteria, viruses, and fungus. 5. Rosemary With natural antibacterial and antiseptic properties, [rosemary essential oil ](https://amzn.to/2PvrYn2)makes an excellent disinfect for washing dishes, cleaning bathroom surfaces, and even in your laundry. It also has an energizing scent that will help deodorize your home. 6. Thyme With powerful cleansing properties, [thyme oil](https://amzn.to/38vscn5) works well for killing kitchen bacteria like salmonella. Use it for washing dishes, utensils, and cutting boards, or cleaning countertops and sinks. 7. Lavender Naturally antibacterial, [lavender oil](https://amzn.to/2LG4Dhx) works well for cleaning toys, dishes, and linens. It's soothing scent is better tolerated than stronger-scented essential oils, and is safe for all ages. 8. Grapefruit [Grapefruit oil](https://amzn.to/38oGYvD) has microbial properties that work to disinfect surfaces and linens in your home. Plus it will offer a fresh, citrusy scent! Peppermint The refreshing scent of [peppermint oil](https://amzn.to/36lDk3L) makes an excellent home deodorizer. It has antibacterial properties, and will deter bugs and rodents. 10. Cinnamon Naturally antibacterial and antiseptic, [cinnamon oil](https://amzn.to/3466gvi) works really well on mold and mildew. It's also effective against pests, and makes your home smell warm and inviting. 11. Pine With its air purifying scent, [pine essential oil](https://amzn.to/2E5KgGf) is great for killing mold, mildew, and other household bacteria. It also works well for cleaning wood floors. By combining essential oils with water, vinegar, and other carriers like castile soap or dish soap, you can make many different types of DIY natural cleaning products. Some examples of homemade essential oil cleaners include: - All purpose spray (see below for recipe) - Toilet scrub - Soft scrub (see below for recipe) - Shower spray - Window cleaner (see below for recipe) - Linen spray - Carpet refresher - Stain remover - Dusting spray What are the benefits of cleaning with essential oils? In addition to being more 'green,' cleaning with essential oils is advantageous in so many ways! The benefits of using essential oils for cleaning are: - They kill bacteria, viruses, fungus, and other germs. - The citrus varieties can easily break down grease and grime. - Homemade cleaners cost far less. - You're in complete control of what you're cleaning with. - They make your home smell great! How do you make natural cleaning products with essential oils? Here are some helpful tricks when making homemade essential oils cleaning recipes. Plus a few safety tips. Things to know when making DIY essential oil cleaners: - Use distilled water when possible. That way you won't be cleaning with any chemicals or hard minerals that might be in your tap water. - Always add essential oil last, after the other ingredients. - Shake bottle or jar to mix well, since you're combining oil and water. - Use [dark amber bottles](https://amzn.to/2qFF7BH)to keep solution good for longer. - Since essential oils can break down plastic, use glass bottles or jars whenever possible. - If you prefer a fainter scent, add 5-10 drops to 3 cups of liquid. - For a stronger scent, add 10-20 drops to 3 cups of liquid. Safety Tips When Using Essential Oils: - Always dilute essential oils. They're very strong in their concentrated form. - Essential oils are never to be consumed or taken internally. - If you are pregnant or have certain health conditions, check with your doctor before using essential oils. - Certain essential oils are not safe for pets. Please check with your vet or read [this helpful article](https://draxe.com/essential-oils-for-pets/)for guidance. How do I make my own cleaning products with essential oils? DIY Essential Oil Cleaning Recipes Here are 3 quick and easy homemade cleaning product recipes! Homemade Essential Oil All Purpose Cleaner Spray: - 2 cups of water - 2 cups of vinegar - 1 tsp dish soap - 50 drops essential oils Note: You can use 50 drops of one kind of oil, or a combination of 2-3 oils. Ideas for essential oil combinations: - Lemon and tea tree - Lemon and lavender - Tea tree and pine - Peppermint, orange and eucalyptus Essential Oil Soft Scrub Cleaner: - 1 cup of baking soda - ¼ cup [castile soap](https://www.amazon.com/Quinns-Castile-Organic-Liquid-Unscented/dp/B075TWC1XB/ref=as_li_ss_tl?crid=1VVD0ZV8XNELH&keywords=castile+soap+liquid&qid=1576014443&sprefix=Castile,pantry,176&sr=8-1-spons&psc=1&spLa=ZW5jcnlwdGVkUXVhbGlmaWVyPUEyS1VXMVFPT0VKNFY0JmVuY3J5cHRlZElkPUEwNDI5NDg0MlFLRTZDRlE3MFNEVSZlbmNyeXB0ZWRBZElkPUEwNjI2NDkyNFdET0RPMkpNR0ZSJndpZGdldE5hbWU9c3BfYXRmJmFjdGlvbj1jbGlja1JlZGlyZWN0JmRvTm90TG9nQ2xpY2s9dHJ1ZQ==&linkCode=ll1&tag=unexpectedlyd-20&linkId=33773ae8a25d289fb1ebcee8e34c1527&language=en_US) - 30 drops citrus essential oil (Such as lemon, lime, grapefruit, wild orange, or a combination of them.) Easy Glass Cleaner Recipe: - 3 cups water (preferably distilled) - ¼ cup of vinegar - ¼ cup of rubbing alcohol (to prevent streaks, and can be omitted) - 20 drops essential oil (lemon or peppermint are refreshing) Ready to try cleaning with essential oils?
